text: Here @supermommajourney - pls. Recipe is all@over internet right??

I have been ordering from Fresher since 2 years ago and they have been nothing but nice. When I needed help with details on keto diet they were always prompt to help me. I feel things were taken out of context by their cheese cake supplier and I never thought that they were cheating me in anyway, in fact I do own a business involving F&B so I do not feel like they did anything malicious or unethical like how people are claiming them to be. To people who are thinking of working with others, put some thought into knowing who you are working with so that you don’t end up in this situation, after giving your best in the business. The feeling must suck to be involved in this unnecessary drama and to be blamed for something you didn’t do wrong but I will continue to support Fresher all the way, even more after this ❤️

I have been a long term customer of Fresher / Fitness Ration. Since the beginning when Fresher introduce the cheesecake as dessert, I was informed by Claire that this cheesecake was a product of their partner, the cheesecake was supplied by their partner and was not made by Fresher. She further confirms verbally with me during our chanced meetup at a gym when she was venturing into providing healthy meals to gym goers. In no way did she steal all the credits from the supplier or mislead me into thinking that the cheesecake is a product of Fresher. I believed she have been outright truthful in how the cheesecake came about as part of their effort to provide healthy meals. I had liked the part when they decided venturing into producing their own version of cheesecake, and I have faith & belief that Fresher and Claire is not morally unethical into stealing their supplier's product. Rather, I believe its their own focus to trial n error venture approach into new business model. This is the Fresher and Claire I know since the start from 5-6 years ago. They are continuously experimenting and adventurous in the development of new receipes. To those who decides not to order from Fresher, I thank you cuz it means I will  face lesser competition with my orders (imagine my exasperation when food is out of stock!). To Fresher, you will have my continued support. Going the thorny path of success isn't easy, but keep in faith and be  morally ethical as you always have been. Cheers. You won't lost a customer in me just cause of this saga.

answers.text: @rena_lala_mikane love this! We’ve been long time customers of @fresher.singapore and Claire & team have always been transparent about things and very customer service oriented. This will@not deter me from my continuous support for Freshwr

text: It is easy to say that "I googled and find the recipe online" after all, we can find how-to on everything online these days. There is also no point arguing about how different the recipes are, whether it's collab or partners. If Fresher claims that they are not collab or partners or related in anyway, then what's the point of drawing reference to SMK in the post. To show how "inspired" they are? OR an intent to somehow "relate" or "imply" that their product is same as SMK? (eg. If I said, I made a drink hugely inspired by Coca Cola, whats the first thing that cross your mind? Definitely not a fruit juice) And it's this reference to SMK and their refusal to address it that is causing all this issue. Going into other details are just trying to divert us from the main point. Which is "what's the point of drawing reference to SMK?" you want to promote business to SMK cakes because you are making your own now? I'm sure as savvy business owners who knows how to trim and cut cost (hopefully not at the expense of cutting quality) to make profit, you can't be making a product while promoting your competitors one right?
Of all desserts you had to do cheesecake.. and state that it was inspired by your previous supplier. Look at the mess you got into. 😂

answers.text: @primel.a it's a point I made earlier lor. 2500 keto desserts out there, @fresher.singapore had to make this one. But. Meh. Have a nice weekend.

text: Just one qn. The pic of the cheesecake on your bundle right now - is it baked by Fresher? Cuz it kinda looks exactly like the one I bought when I bought the earlier bundle with the cake NOT baked by Fresher.

@kaitinghearts I wrote a longer explanation below on why i think what fresher did is morally wrong and ultimately not nice. i will acknowledge there may not be theft involved. Lost my biz, and I'm sure those of many others too, hope you still continue to support your friend. Cheers
Clarity*

answers.text: @kaitinghearts @mingshuang @jolenecrosses @fresher.singapore  these examples are quite stupid la. Cuz the copied item isnt a raw material. A more relevant example would be say if @fresher.singapore supplied to say Seriously Keto. Or even Neo Garden! Someone bigger. Good, because fresher gets more coverage and neo garden reaches more market segments, right? Then one day the bigger company suddenly put out on its websites all these meals that are exactly the same as fresher's. Even photos v similar.  Then told fresher just 1 day before launch kthnxbye.  Then how you feel? You'll feel angry for your friend being robbed right?  Or u going to say Neo or whoever has the absolute right to do so because fresher is just a "supplier"? I mean if u can hand-to-heart say it's the latter, then I salute u for being consistent, and hands down I lost this argument. But... can you?

@yakinicwu @yakinicwu @yakinicwu DONT TWIST MY WORDS. Read my comment properly. I never agree they are wrong. I said I don’t think they did anything wrong. Don’t put words in my mouth girl, it’s not nice. will you like it if I anyhow put words on your mouth? 2. PLEASE EXPLAIN THE WAY IT IS DONE THAT IS WRONG PLS. You keep say it’s wrong but you don’t say WHAT IS WRONG. 3. THE CAKE IN THE PIC IS NOT FROM SMK stop insinuating that it is because FRESHER ALREADY REPLIED YOU IT IS NOT SMK’S CAKE SMK DID NOT BAKE THAT CAKE. 4. Who send army of trolls? I came here on my own accord. If you wanna say fresher sent us, then is it fair for me to say SMK sent an army of trolls like you here? 5. They didn’t do 1001 nice things in covid. Let me explain the situation to you since you wanna know. DURING COVID 19 @leehsienloong say home Bakers cannot do business. So SMK cannot sell correct? So how? fresher ownself bake. Which part of it do you not understand? Then are you going to apologise for putting words in my mouth? If not, hats off to you for replying but shame on you for not apologising

@yakinicwu Fresher has also introduced their clients to her. If at that point SMK “supposedly thought it was a collaboration” and knew that the cakes was not known to be SMK’s cakes, why didn’t she make noise then? She should have questioned fresher from the FIRST CAKE they sent out why is there no logo, no label. But she knew this was happening and she did not dispute that because she knows they were working on a supplier - merchant term! Why only now make noise when they decide not to take supplies from her? The reason why there was no need to say oh these cheese cakes are from SMK is because it was a freaking supplier and merchant relationship. Do you see Neo Garden telling everyone which company their chicken and beef comes from? Like “hey this is my beef Rendang made with beef that was farmed from  ABC BEEF factory in malaysia, here is their ig handle @abcbeef” like ?????? Did you know

@yakinicwu If you consider fresher making the same cheesecake as being robbed then she got to be damn angry at all the other people who are making the exact same cheesecake AND selling them too, be consistent with what you say. If you’re angry with Fresher copying your cheesecake, then you got to be angry at everyone else. If not you’re just being biased and getting mad at fresher because they stopped supply with you and you’re salty about it.
@mingshuang i scared i change egg supplier ppl say i steal the chicken's DNA

@yakinicwu Firstly y’all got to stop being delusional. The reason why we used these examples is simply because the relationship was indeed a merchant and a supplier relationship. Things were offered on credit terms and smk was asked for a commercial rate, which she responded to. Do you think a collaboration would encompass all of these? Y’all have to understand that there proper business terms to everything, not just loosely hang the word “collaboration” around your mouth because she felt like Fresher was collaborating with her. Well that kinda just shows how nice the people at fresher are then, they treat their supplier so nice to the point their supplier thinks it’s a collaboration. Stop using words like they were
@kaitinghearts @bakedbyketokit i think now buy eggs and sugar must credit them also. In cass when i change supplier pple gonna post my cakes n say i steal their sugar.
@jolenecrosses all the rice brands should kp NTUC for making their own home brand

@yakinicwu partners etc, if nobody has shares in each other’s company, they are NOT partners, and both did not claim to be business partners as well And back to your point on the bigger players, if you aim to be bigger one day, your company has to stop being so irrational about things like these. It wasn’t an outright ripoff, they had customers to serve that they couldn’t due to the lack of supply because of the covid 19 situation. They had to think of a plan B. They had orders for a cheese cake and if they do NOT make a cheese cake that LOOKS like a cheese cake then is it even a cheese cake? And is it compulsory for Fresher to update their supplier on what they are coming up for their house brand, what’s their contingency plan on a daily basis? If your answer is NO, then why are you making noise? If your answer is yes, don’t you think you’re a demanding supplier who needs to know what the merchant is doing? Does Neo Garden ask their supplier what they are feeding their chicken every day? And if y’all want to say Fresher is some big boy out in the market that is so untrue, not like Smk never seen them before? They are a small team of people who are working even until 5-6am, and the F&B world IS LIKE THAT. So quit whining about

@mingshuang sorry reread yr story. So basically u agree fresher is wrong but because they did 1001 nice things and because covid, it's okay. And. I think. stop it la. I really try to be v patient but u all keep using unfair conjectures. I'm not angry at fresher for selling cheesecake or the lemonturdmuffin thing. Its about the way its done, how hard is it to understand that? At the start they nv tell ppl. Now edit already, send army of trolls to ppl who spark the edit. And... It's not even obvious that the pic they post on their website is a pic of a cake THEY baked leh. Cuz if it's not, then potentially misselling cuz that cake sho pretty. But im sure fresher can bake a prettier one since all the recipes on the internet seem to show pretty cakes only. But ultimately. Case closed.  I wont buy from fresher, u probably wont buy from the baker, we all made our cases, conclusion is we have different morale standards, we draw different lines, and hats off to Claire for keeping this thread open bu5 shame on youfor not just apologising (which frankly, resolves everything)

WHICH FREAKING COMPANY DOES THAT? Is it maybe they shouldn’t be so nice? And yes, you should be angry if your friend is robbed. answers.text: @fuxiaowen @t.cj they were NEVER PARTNERS to begin with.
@mingshuang probably a friend of theirs and I don’t think you’re making any sense but thank you for the advice :)
@t.cj and you probably need screenshots and receipts before you start defending people you think you know
@bakedbyketokit hello, we noticed you haven't read our DM yet. Please do read it first to know the other side of the story, and we're very open to hear your thoughts about this matter :) thank you!

@t.cj it’s not unethical if both sides benefited from the collaboration. If you’re saying that the Japanese keto cake baker gave fresher everything and not get anything in return then ya it’s unethical. But don’t tell me she didn’t benefit from fresher’s customers too? Only she introduced clients to them? A collaboration is a two way thing. And during the times when home baking services were not available, they made the cakes themselves from Google and realised that they can do it then why not? How to steal a recipe when no recipe was given? I don’t understand is there something i’m missing? I don’t feel like you’re trying to understand the situation. If today I am taking supplies from ABC store, but DEF charge me cheaper for the same thing, why won’t I change supplier? Regardless we can still all support each other in this local business scene, why have to make a huge hoohah and attack each other? It’s just one less collaboration, and there are so many people who can collaborate with Japanese keto cake? I’m sure many people want to try. But now, I would be scared to collaborate because if I ever chose to end the collaboration I would probably be called out as a bully with no substantial evidence but just what you feel. I apologise to you for being rude but I’m just like what are you guys thinking man? Lol.

@mingshuang I don't know if you know the full story but my understanding is the Baker has tried all ways to supply to fresher, even during difficult times. Fresher is of course allowed to source for cheaper options, drop soulmyeketo, do whatever they want. What is NOT acceptable is... Experimenting with the recipe (or so they say) without telling the original baker, make plans to launch it behind her back, inform her they are dropping her ONE DAY before the launch, advertising their new  in house bake as if it were the one customers have been ordering all this while. Please get the facts right. Fresher is free to make their own. Kudos to them if they say they have mastered the recipe on their own. But what is NOT COOL is being UNETHICAL in the manner by which they want to end the collab. Give credit where credit is due. The cakes were from soulmyeketo. End of story. NOT fresher.
@t.cj then you’re friend better start flaming every single Japanese keto cake recipe on google and maybe get a patent for it so nasty people like fresher cannot steal original ideas from them. :)
@mingshuang mitigate the situation**

@fuxiaowen For the record, nothing was stolen. No recipe was exchanged. We made this ourselves, honestly from the many recipes published on Google + tweaked it. Just like many other home bakers on carousell selling this Keto Jap Cheesecake.
@mingshuang trust me I definitely know better than you do

@fuxiaowen i m impressive that you can steal a recipe just by looking/eating it. @fresher.singapore must be genius then! I wish i had the same talent! Btw there is such thing as google which thousands n millions of recipe in case u dont know. Thank me later

@bakedbyketokit okay, if that was the case did soulmyketo voice out her unhappiness to fresher? If she did and fresher didn’t apologise or insisted to continue then I agree that what fresher did was wrong, because you can’t put laws to being ethical, it is when you feel that something is not right, and you still do it, that’s not being ethical. However if both parties were okay with the decision with no signs of unhappiness how come suddenly will become like some unethical situation? This puzzles me a lot. I read soulmyketo’s ig story but I don’t understand what she is upset about?

@t.cj well, if covid 19 didn’t allow people to do home baking services then is the company supposed to just stop orders? If you owned a business you would probably need to find solutions to mitigate the system no? And also, what’s wrong with doing it themselves? If the supplier is too expensive, is it in a business point of view to continue with that supplier? Do you think Macdonalds take supplies from a home made chicken nugget factory? This is life and business, if it was a proper collaboration there should be a contract and all, FYI, posting stuff with no evidence is called slandering, and you can be sued with defamation. Just putting it out there.
@mingshuang and before you start defending your friend, I suggest you to do what you have just suggested me.

@bakedbyketokit and this post that you’re commenting on has their ig tag on it ah? Where never give credit? And does soulmyketo know what was going on during this whole time? You mean she didn’t know that they were giving out her cakes to their clients?

@fuxiaowen Hello, we’re trying to drop you a DM to clarify. Right now we’re unable to do so as it’s private. Do you mind accept our request so we can respond directly to you? You can delete us thereafter.

@mingshuang nah just calling out unethical practice. You are clearly unfamiliar between the difference and your analogy isn’t making sense so I won’t spend any time replying to you after this but kudos, you’re a supportive friend I must say.

@fresher.singapore that’s different. You partnered with someone who is baking keto cheesecakes and only keto cheesecakes and received great responses, and right after you decided to kick them out and bake your own. Your cake and description are exactly and if not highly similar.

text: Who would ever dare collaborate with you again if you are going to deconstruct and steal their stuff? Vv disappointing.

answers.text: @fresher.singapore I'd be happy to give you benefit of doubt, but you gotta admit it's dirty af and I could list for you.  1. The collab had brought u new customers. I for one would never have ordered frozen meals until the original baker shared yr site. 2.  U didn't disclose upfront the cake was not by her. I would have been conned into ordering again, since packaging it with meals would have cut delivery costs substantially. 3. Basically what im reading of your actions was you "collaborated" to test market, and then barged in It's one thing if you decided to make say, CHOCOLATE cheese cake or matcha, or something else. Doing the exact same item is just dishonorable.  I can go on. And dude, I dont even know this lady personally, I just like her cakes, and have a strong moral compass.  Now, if this was because the collaboration was unpleasant and u decide never to work with her again, that's another story altogether, and again I could afford further benefit of doubt there. But I've bought from her 3x and each time was nothing but pleasant so I find that hard to believe.

@yakinicwu For the record, nothing was stolen. No recipe was exchanged. We made this ourselves, honestly from the many recipes published on Google + tweaked it. Just like many other home bakers on carousell selling this Keto Jap Cheesecake.

text: Gotta say it's pretty disappointing you would treat your partners this way, to collaborate then the very next month come up with something exactly the same as theirs.
